result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katherine M Vogel

9:09 AM Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Katherine M Vogel. Attorney appears by authorization. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense is in receipt of the restitution number, Defendant will be making a $200.00 payment tomorrow on the total $800.00 payment. Defense requests a plea/sentencing date for an ordinance resolution. 
Court sets.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

01:41 PM Attorney J Andrew Herbers in court.   Defendant Katherine M Vogel did not appear. Authorization to appear received and filed. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Defense is still awaiting restitution amount from the State. 
State does not have an update on restitution, and will send a note to responsible DA. 
Court will set another FP date. 

  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Ross Dress For Less listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:29 AM Defendant Katherine M Vogel in court with attorney J Andrew Herbers.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
